results.title: Two towns: Gubbio in Italy, Chillicothe in Ohio
results.creator_credit: John H. Secondari, Helen Jean Secondari and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Explains that the towns of Gubbio in Italy and Chillicothe in southeastern Ohio are both agricultural centres of about 30,000 people. Describes the different value systems based on historical, cultural and geographical factors. Shows scenes of daily routines.

results.title: Two sisters
results.brief_description: Viola lives her life in isolation, hiding her disfigured face from the outside world in a darkened room where she writes her novels. Marie, her sister and only companion, takes care of her every need, acting as her protector from the cruelty she perceives surrounds them. The two women happily live as co-dependant social pariahs until a male stranger arrives and throws their tenuous order into chaos. Caroline Leaf’s masterful animated short explores the psychological ramifications of isolation and the distortions it can create in a persons mind.

results.title: Two pots, a caffe latte, a scotch and dry, a vodka lime and lemon, and a small antipasto with 5 forks
results.creator_credit: Matt Saville, Peter Tammer and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Waitress Elaine finds herself face to face with ex boyfriend, Rory, when he turns up to her yuppie watering hole for a drink. On her break she describes the decline of the relationship to her co-worker, and before the shift is over she is able to wreak revenge thanks to a stolen mobile phone and a cleverly procured visa card. Cast includes Caroline Bock, David Cotter and Elena Mendalis.

results.title: Two out of five
results.creator_credit: Francine Vande Wiele, Jean Calvell and Unesco
results.brief_description: Two out of five of the world’s population cannot read or write, and the campaign to promote literacy is of great importance for economic and social development. Scenes in African and Asian countries illustrate the great efforts being made in many underdeveloped areas.

results.title: Two of a kind
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man in the Making”
Discusses the similarities and differences, due to heredity and environment, to be seen in identical and fraternal twins.

results.title: Two mountain lands: Andes and Alps
results.creator_credit: Andrew B. Nemes, Audio Visual Productions and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Contrasts the life of a Swiss Alpine dairy farmer with that of a terrace farmer from the Peruvian Andes. Shows differences in farming methods, transportation systems, traditions and economic structures. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew B. Nemes, Audio Visual Productions and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: Two men of Fiji
results.creator_credit: Brett Porter, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Jaile and Adriu lived on Kakeba Island in the Lay group.Adriu left to study medicine in Suva and his friend Jaile crept away to join him. But Jaile soon found that life in Suva was lonely and difficult for an island boy. Back home he found his place again, working among things he knew, with his friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brett Porter, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit

results.title: Two little frosts
results.brief_description: An animated story in the style of a folk tale in which man is pitted against the elements. The personified frost creatures assume that an old man will fall easily prey to their ability to freeze. Despite all their efforts, the experienced woodman unknowingly defeats the two little frosts.

results.title: Two languages are better than one
results.creator_credit: Jan Denton, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A bilingual program offers instruction in two languages. Substantial community support is required to successfully establish a bilingual program. This may be forcoming if people are provided with sufficient information upon which to base fruitful discussion. This video provides a starting point for such discussion.

results.title: Two in the bush: the Attic of the world
results.creator_credit: Christopher Parsons and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Two in the Bush”.
The naturalist, Gerald Durrell, observes Australian wild life. On a sheep farm he sees the problems kangaroos pose for farmers and meets some scientists doing field work on “roos”. He also sees the birth of a kangaroo, and its trip into its mother’s pouch. Research on the breeding biology of animals is also seen.
